clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound-guided Regional Anesthesia vs Local Infiltration Anesthesia With Dexmedetomidine and Ropivacaine
clinical_study.official_title: Dexmedetomidine as Adjunct Medication to Local Infiltration Anesthesia (LIA) vs Ultrasound-Guided Regional Anesthesia (USRA) in Regard to Patients' Need for Opioids, Wellbeing, Satisfaction, and Knee Functionality in Knee-endoprosthetics

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of the Impact of dexmedetomidine as an adjunct for local infiltrations analgesia and ultrasound-based regional anaesthesia as pain medication in regard to patients' opioid need the first 48 hours after the total knee replacement operation.

detailed_description.textblock: Evaluation of the Impact of dexmedetomidine as an adjunct for local infiltrations analgesia and ultrasound-based regional anaesthesia as pain medication in regard to patients' opioid need the first 48 hours after the total knee replacement operation. Secondary objectives are: Pain assesment, Pain medication necessary, functionality of the prothesis, satisfaction, wellbeing, postoperative discomforts, complications (delirium, allergic reactions, cardiopulmonary decompensation), procedure specific time.

primary_outcome.measure: Need of opioid consumption in oral morphine equivalent
primary_outcome.description: consumed opioids in mg of oral morphine equivalent

secondary_outcome.description: Pain experienced by patients according to self-assesment according to NRS (Numeric rating scale) (minimum 0, maximum 10) (higher score means worse outcome)
Need of opioid consumption in mg of oral morphine equivalent up to the 5th postoperative day

secondary_outcome.measure: Functionality of the prothesis - OKS (Oxford Knee Score)
secondary_outcome.description: According to physical examination by the Oxford Knee Score (minimum 0, maximum 48) (higher score means better outcome)

secondary_outcome.measure: Functionality of the prothesis- KOOS (Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score)
secondary_outcome.description: According to physical examination by the orthopedics score KOOS (minimum 0, maximum 100) (higher score means better outcome)

secondary_outcome.measure: Functionality of the prothesis - WOMAC (Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Osteoarthritis Index)
secondary_outcome.description: According to physical examination by the orthopedics score WOMAC (minimum 0, maximum 96) (higher score means worse outcome)

secondary_outcome.measure: Functionality of the prothesis- G-FJS (German Forgotten Joint Score)
secondary_outcome.description: According to physical examination by the orthopedics score G-FJS (minimum 0, maximum 100) (higher score means better outcome)
Incidence of complications in total (e.g. delirium, allergic reactions, cardiopulmonary decompensation)

arm_group.description: Patient will be given a peripheral nerve block from their treating anesthesiologist before the operation (in the OR) with an conventional ultrasound guided femoral and sciatic block of each 15 ml ropivacaine 0,5% and 0,5 ml dexmedetomidine (100µg/ml).
Patient will be given a local infiltration analgesia from their treating surgeon during the operation (in the OR) with 60 ml ropivacaine 0,5% and 1 ml dexmedetomidine (100µg/ml).

intervention.description: Applied perineurally preoperatively ultrasound guided regional anesthesia
Applied in the wound intraoperatively from the orthopedics

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult
- non pregnant
- patients with gonarthrosis who have given written consent for participation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age below 18 years
- pregnancy
- breast-feeding patients
- allergies against study medication
- missing or denied written consent
